intro: Anemone pennsylvanica var. laxmannii, commonly known as the laxmannii anemone, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, white to pink petals and a central cluster of yellow stamens. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and has a rhizomatous root system that allows it to spread vegetatively. Its leaves are palmately divided, with a coarse texture, and it blooms in early spring before the canopy of trees fully develops.
